item.title: Devolver Digital and DeadToast Entertainment announce side-scrolling precision platformer Shotgun Cop Man for Switch, PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/devolver-digital-and-deadtoast-entertainment-announce-side-scrolling-precision-platformer-shotgun-cop-man-for-switch-pc

  • PC
  • Switch

Demo now available.

Publisher Devolver Digital and My Friend Pedro developer DeadToast Entertainment have announced side-scrolling precision platformer Shotgun Cop Man, a side-scrolling precision platformer coming to Switch PC via Steam in 2025. A demo is available now for PC.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Blast your way through hell in Shotgun Cop Man, a precision platformer where your weapons are your wings.

Embark on a mission to arrest Satan armed with a devastating arsenal and a relentless thirst for glory. Propel yourself through hordes of irritable demons, devious traps, and thrilling challenges using the only two things you can trust: your wits and your weapons.

Conquer the handcrafted campaign or dive into user-generated levels in this fire and brimstone-fueled mission to serve justice.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Firepower Propulsion – Master your movement through the twisted corners of hell as every shot propels you forward. Whether dodging enemies, scaling walls, or leaping impossible gaps, your weapons are the key to both survival and traversal.
  • Explosive Campaign and Challenges – Dive into an action-packed campaign in over 150 levels and face off against intense boss battles, then put yourself to the test and beat all the No Damage, Speedrun and Kill All challenges. Keep the infernal fun alive with an ever expanding choice of devious user-generated campaigns.
  • Create Your Own Hellish Playground – Let your creativity shine with the built-in level editor and Steam Workshop integration. Craft, share, and conquer custom levels to push the game and your peers to their limits.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.
